project.title: Antenna Control Unit (ACU) Redesign
project.short_description: Redesigned a marine/vehicular satellite ACU with industrial sensors, beacon receiver, and a modular firmware architecture.

details.overview: A full redesign of a rack-mount Antenna Control Unit used in mobile satellite tracking systems for ships and trains.
goals: Improve connection stability in harsh sea conditions (up to force 10)
Replace low-grade sensors with industrial/automotive versions
Integrate a satellite beacon receiver for precise tracking
Make firmware structure modular, scalable, and portable
key_features: Beacon receiver integrated directly into PCB
Ethernet, RS485, and USB interface support
Noise-optimized PCB design with improved EMC/EMI performance

milestones.title: PCB Architecture Redesign
milestones.description: Created multi-layer board with isolated power, optimized routing, and EMC/EMI improvements.

milestones.title: Firmware Refactor
milestones.description: Modular structure added with drivers, middleware, and communication layers.

milestones.title: Sensor Fusion Implementation
milestones.description: Implemented EKF-based fusion algorithm for stability in high-vibration conditions.

milestones.title: System-Level Testing
milestones.description: Tested full ACU + antenna system in real marine conditions.
